Reviews.Title: Good camera if you don't mind a little headache.
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera over a Kodak only because of the price. When I first got the cam, it already had an issue---it wouldn't turn on with the rechargeable batteries I had. I tried some disposable ones just to see if the camera even worked and sure enough it did, but it drank 'em up in about 5 minutes. I thought to myself, "surely this cannot be right." So eventually, I checked on the [...] site and I came to find that the A835 and one other model has battery issues that could supposedly be corrected with a firmware update. I followed the instructions to fix the cam but it didn't work. After getting completely fed up with it, I contacted GE and all they could tell me was to use different batteries, some of the name brand ones. I had nearly given up on the camera altogether until something told me that I hadn't done the firmware update correctly....I was right. The file that needed to go on the SD card was apparently in the wrong place because after moving it around, I got the cam to FINALLY work! (*phew*)Now, I only gave this product 3 stars because of the headache I've had for the past week trying to fix it and the scare it gave me initially that I had bought a c-h-e-a-p camera. Otherwise, the features are great, pictures and video are of decent quality (for the price) and the battery usage is....MUCH better, now that I have it working like it should. Still haven't used it an extended amount of time to see its true endurance, but it lasts longer than 5 minutes now, so I'm a happy camper.To the potential buyers: consider my experience as a heads-up for what you can possibly go through if you purchase this camera. I don't know if every A835 has the battery issue but if there's a bulletin on the general-imaging website, chances are that you're going to be facing this problem too. Buy at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Keith James Thomson
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this camera.  Be sure to read every page of the manual and go through the features.  The manual is well written and easy, but if you don't learn what the camera can do you will miss out.  Fantastic price.  Obviously GE wanted to sell some cameras at this point in time so they put a real goodie on the market for a good price.  I'm so happy with this.  I originally wanted the silver tone, but right now they are doing all the best sales on the black tone which is beautiful; it's only that I feared that the black my eventually scratch.  So what.  I am so happy with this camera and all the flexible features it has to take photos under different circumstances.  Its body is a just tad lightweight if you pick up a pricier similar sized camera in the other hand, but the camera is functioning very smoothly and does not feel chintzy.  We'll see how it wears over time, but it's worth if it serves for even only two years.  I'm going to take good care of it and count on getting five years.  Very happy.  (added note:  five months later and I'm still very happy with this camera).

Reviews.Title: Still learning but happy with it
Reviews.Author: East Columbia
Reviews.Content: As someone mentioned, the batteries tend to run out of juice quickly while using the camera. I called the company because I only had 23 pictures and a very short video and I was on my second set of AA Duracells.  Apparently, there was a problem with the "firmware upgrade".  I was told what to do online to resolve the problem and also told to use Energizer AA lithium batteries for longer life.  I was told that the upgrade would be quite simple.  My son did it for me and said that it was easy to do.  I don't know yet if the problem is fixed but I am glad that a solution was offered by the company.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Keonyn
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice little camera, particularly for the price you pay. It isn't incredibly feature rich, doesn't have all the manual options and bells and whistles, and the zoom is 3X at most which is lacking compared to more expensive models.This is not an expensive camera though, and it works quite well for what it is and makes a great little point and clicker to take along with you wherever you go. The body of the camera is a bit larger than some of the competition, but it also feels a lot more durable. The cameras construction actually feels quite solid, especially when compared to the extra slim models released by other companies.The controls are quite simple, with all the options on a scroll wheel at the top with the shutter release in the center and a power button next to it. The front of the camera has only the flash, lens and a small red/orange LED on the bottom corner by the lens that is used for red eye reduction. The back is pretty much all screen, with a few navigation and trash buttons. The bottom of the camera has a small door which houses the batteries and the SD card slot, and there is a tripod mount right beside that battery port.The pictures themselves are quite nice, even when the flash is used. The flash has a pretty limited range, probably 10 to 12 feet at most. It works for portraits and such, but don't expect to make much use of the zoom feature if you're relying on the flash for illumination. This is pretty typical really though, even with more expensive cameras. The screen is prone to glares, so it can be hard to view on very bright days. The pictures within the range of the optical zoom of the camera and the flashes range (if it's used) all turn out quite well. The colors come out vivid and accurate, and bleeding or discoloration doesn't seem to be a problem.One downside of the camera is its use of standard AA batteries instead of a rechargeable battery. NiMH rechargeable AA's work just fine in the camera and last a reasonable length of time, not the best longevity, but far from the worst. The batteries last significantly longer when the flash isn't being used, using the flash will drop the battery life in half; but again, this isn't unusual for cameras. Another downside is the screen, which actually works quite well, but LCD screens eat up the batteries and a viewfinder can go a long ways to maximizing battery life. Unfortunately this camera has no viewfinder, so you are reliant on the screen. Luckily it does have a sleep mode that it will go in to if the camera remains unused for a user defined period of time.All in all it's a pretty good little camera for a digital at this tier. The picture quality is good and the battery life is reasonable, though not the greatest. It easily compares to cameras from other well known manufacturers, like Samsung, Kodak, and Sony (I've used Kodaks up until this one). It's of solid construction and feels quite durable. It doesn't have many bells and whistles and the location of the SD port could be problematic if you tend to change out your cards often. It's a great camera if you're just looking for something simple though, and comes at a great price. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice features - but a battery hog
Reviews.Author: Wally
Reviews.Content: Looks like GE tried packing lots of features in this camera.  I really tried to like this camera, but the one I got is a battery hog -- even after the firmware update.  When I first got this camera, it didn't work with rechargeable batteries.  After the update, it would work for a short time, then shortly show the battery level dropping til it the battery didn't power the camera at all despite me having the batteries freshly charged and the firmware updated.Pros: pretty camera (like the piano black); large LCD screen; user friendly interfaceCons: eats battery like crazy, I decided that I need different camera; some pictures were blurry

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Kellee
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice camera, it has alot of features and works very well, had to study the book for the extras I had no idea how to use. After that I like it.

Reviews.Title: "Battery Exhausted" always after a few months of mild use
Reviews.Author: ziggy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift for Christmas in 08 and by the spring of 09 it started giving me trouble. I use rechargable batteries, and it started shutting down and telling me that the batteries were exhausted. After 3 more months of use, it would barely be usable before shutting down. Here's the annoying part. The batteries it told me were exhausted, worked perfectly fine in any other camera. I just recently started trying to use it again, and it won't get past the "Batteries exhausted" screen. The websites have downloads to fix this yet the links no longer exist, and with my camera not turning on it's of no use. Save yourself a headache, some money, and do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: mommy of 2 kiddos
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! I purchased it on Monday from Tiger Direct and received it on Tuesday with just standard shipping. It has so many features and I love that it takes 2 AA batteries and not those rechargable ones because you never have to worry about it dying, you can just take batteries with you if your running low. My mother has an Olympus camera that was over $200 and this one is better than that because it has so many more features and much more megapixels! I would highly recommend to anyone, and it comes at such a great deal!

Reviews.Title: excellent camera and a good price!
Reviews.Author: N. Shoemaker
Reviews.Content: Great quality pics, decent video capabilities.  Downside is that the batteries run down quickly when useing standard AAs.  Upside is that no proprietary battery means you can slap just about any batteries in there that you have handy!  Also, when the batteries do run down, it apparently sometimes doesn't leave enough reserve juice to retract the lens... which leaves it sticking out if you don't have new batteries to put in immediately.

Reviews.Title: satisficed
Reviews.Author: Roberto Moreno
Reviews.Content: it was very nice. it was like  expected. I'm very satisficed.i recommended this product to my friends all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good value camera.
Reviews.Author: JDOR1967
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a while now and it does take good pictures but has a couple drawbacks.1. Pictures can be slow to save so you can't take fast pictures in hi res mode.2. Does not have good picture stabilization.It is a good value for the price just don't expect the form and function of a high end camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera, excellent pictures!
Reviews.Author: NotBeingSmart "HarryPotter"
Reviews.Content: This camera is of average size(compact) but it literally eats batteries. The brand of battery does not matter nor does the type of battery. But the pictures are surprising crisp. Wish I could find a battery to overcome this battery eater.

Reviews.Title: A no frills camera when we bought it.  Still going after 4 years.
Reviews.Author: J. Smith "Scientist"
Reviews.Content: When I was a kid, I loved taking pictures.  It was waiting to the pictures processed that left me wanting more.  So, when my son expressed an interest in photography, I ordered this simple inexpensive camera - a first use camera.  I had every intention of getting him a nicer camera if his interest blossomed.  It did not.  But, he still likes to take pictures on occasion and this little camera does the job and continues to keep working after 4 years.  It does eat batteries, but then most cameras do.

Reviews.Title: A picture sais a thousend words
Reviews.Author: Mike Sisco
Reviews.Content: purchased this as a gift for my daughter. Turns out the battery life is low, and replacing the AA bats twice a week can get annoying and expensive. (needs a rechargeable battery pack)The picture quality is good in high light settings but poor in low light. If you have lots of AA battery's and are taking pictures in  high light situations then this camera is for you.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS.
Reviews.Author: Sandee
Reviews.Content: None of the other features matter, because EVERY time you want to take a picture, the BATTERIES are DEAD.It uses batteries like a PIG, and if you can't use the camera, it's no use rating it. I bought it for my daughter,and had to apologize to her, shamefacedly.

Reviews.Title: no warranty!
Reviews.Author: M. Pruna "Inbound bandits"
Reviews.Content: Lens got stuck, tried to call warranty for replacement, they refused and offered a for-pay repair option instead. The breakage occured less than two months after the item was purchased, new.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Lee
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera-basic and it so far seems reliable.  Worked right out of the box with minimal instruction book time and have not had a problem with it.  Well worth trying if you aren't looking for something fancy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: K. Mckinnon
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It's my first digital so I'm still learning everything it can do.  The pictures it takes are exceptional!  You must get an additional memory card as there is little storage in the camera's memory.  Regular batteries do not last long so get lithium batteries right away and save yourself some frustration.  For the price, the camera is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: GE is  a good ol' reliable partner
Reviews.Author: T. harrington "master of piddlin' round"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year.  I actually use it more for work than anything else, but it works like a champ and never lets me down.  I particularly like the ability to use regular AA batteries.  I've got a Sony I never use because I always forget to charge the dang battery pack.  Who knew GE did cameras (well the chinese did the camera, GE just sells it).

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: shecatch22
Reviews.Content: Pros:  The camera is small and sleek, yet still has a decent sized screen for viewing.  It has many useful settings to assist the novice photographer.Cons:  For 8MP, I thought the photos lacked the crispness and clarity they should have had.  Although the camera states that it has image stabilization, many of my pictures turned out blurry - especially those taken with the zoom.  I have an older Olympus, with fewer MP that takes much better pictures but, in all fairness, it wasn't as affordable as this GE camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J Kleinschmidt "map maker"
Reviews.Content: We gave these cameras to our kids for an Easter/Spring break gift. The pictures they took were great and they are very simple to use and download.I had read that there was a battery issue that could be fixed with downloading some updated firmware but we have not encountered any battery issues as of yet.

Reviews.Title: Good first digital camera
Reviews.Author: R. E. Frazee
Reviews.Content: These cameras, I purchased two for my Grandsons, were just what they needed. The camera uses AA batteries which are easily replaced or replaced with rechargeable Ni-Mh as I have done. The camera has sufficient bells and whistles to keep my older grandson's interest and is easily used by my younger grandson as a point and shoot device. I found the camera about average in its power consumption. The price was attractive enough for me to purchase two and also equipped them with 2Gb memories. All told I feel they were an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: good price
Reviews.Author: Roccy J. Collazo
Reviews.Content: it is a nice camera but had a problem with holding the charge on the battery so i called GE and they help me download a firmware for it and the problem is solve.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Wanda Mckissick "Satisfied"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera with lots of features. Easy to work, even for a beginner. Enjoyed using this camera.

Reviews.Title: Even a dummy can use it!
Reviews.Author: junkstoremolly
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use, even for a dummy like me who has never had good luck with a camera.  This is a great point-and-shoot camera for someone that doesn't like all the bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Tin Zaw "Tin Zaw"
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera for its price ($70). It is light and easy to use. The LCD screen is big and bright. I bought it for my father and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: RestlessBoomer
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a good friend who is not real camera savvy and had no experience with a digital camera.  She loves it!  It's easy to use and takes excellent photos.  Has a lot of little "bells and whistles"--plenty for a beginner--and, once she gets the hang of all the things it can do, I'm sure the memory card will be full.  It's a nice size and is of good quality.  It's a good idea to get the lithium batteries since these products use a lot of battery power.  Good product for the money.GE-A835 8MP Digital Camera with 3X Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: Good camera... many functions
Reviews.Author: Colleen A. Houtz "Am I a ghost? You wouldn't ...
Reviews.Content: This camera was great for the money. My friend and I took pictures of each other all afternoon. There are a lot of features whose purposes elude me, but it has all the functions I need, including smile detection and red-eye removal. Taking and viewing images is easy once I managed to figure out the turn-style on the top of the camera. I have yet to explore all the options for video and image capture, but overall this is a good, multi-purpose camera; delivered in a timely fashion with all the necessary parts and instructions.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Conrad LoPrete
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a 6 year old photographer.  He reports that it is "awesome" at taking photos and I fully agree with him.  It is very easy to use and uploading pictures to my laptop is simple.  I would purchase this camera for myself If I needed a great, reliable, easy to operate digital camera.  The viewing screen on the back of the camera is large and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a young person
Reviews.Author: J. A. Duncan
Reviews.Content: We gave this camera to our 10yr old grandson for Christmas and he's loving it.  In fact, he watched the videos he took so much that he used up the first set of batteries in two days!  He's already wanting to learn how to send the pictures he's taken to family and friends, too.  It seems to be an ideal camera for the young and probably anyone who wants an easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: GE 8mp camera
Reviews.Author: B. A. Cox
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter got this camera for Christmas, and she loved it! She is 9, and took some great pics with very little practice. Very good product, and the price was great.

Reviews.Title: Finally a cheap camera worth buying
Reviews.Author: S. G. Marcano "Samy"
Reviews.Content: For three years now I have been buying my mom Digital camera's for christmas. Each year I have failed to get her a good camera so I decided to Look into General Electrics because I believe they are a good company and they are!My mom has always wanted a good digital camera that she can just snap photo's with and this product is excellent. Though I had read some other reviews about the battery dying quickly so i bought her recharagable ones and she has no complaints and she takes it with her everywhere!I was a little skeptical about other people's reviews that where low, but in my opinion they just had bad luck.

Reviews.Title: It is just an excellent but short term camera
Reviews.Author: Monica Gor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in  because the price. I was amazed of all the features and quality of pictures. I traveled for Christmas and I took 300 pics, then I traveled in summer, 1200 more pics, last Christmas again, 600 pics and my camera died!! It was never hit, well taken care but not long life. So we can say it is a one year camera if you take a lot of pics. If not...it can last.

Reviews.Title: ilikewhatigot
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Martinez "whosurdaddy"
Reviews.Content: I am a lawenforcement officer. I purchased this camera for that use and for my personal use as well. It has meet and/or exceeded my expectations and i recommend this for the non professional photographer.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it - The Battery issue is that severe
Reviews.Author: Amazonsrule
Reviews.Content: I didn't believe the prior reviews about the battery and how bad the drainage is, don't make my same mistake!

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: R. Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son one year ago for Christmas and it went through the batteries like crazy. It didn't produce a quality picture either. Fast forward one year and I had to buy him another one for this Christmas because it stopped working altogether. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality components
Reviews.Author: Rutherford
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my adult daughter. She liked the size and ease of use. However, the build quality of the camera was poor.  Almost right away the lens cover stopped working properly and within a few months the entire camera had gone belly up.  I gave her an Olympus Stylus to replace it and won't purchase another GE.

Reviews.Title: Does the job, just not quickly.
Reviews.Author: brandilion
Reviews.Content: This camera is fine.  It takes nice pictures.  It's cheap and easy to use.  The only thing that disappoints me is how slow it is with the review.  After you take a picture, you have to wait a little while for it to show up on the LCD.  I haven't had any of the battery problems other users have described.I bought this to be a pocket camera for close up snapshots out and about town when I want something I don't need a separate bag for.  I have a much fancier camera for my "real" photos, but this works just fine for fun snapshots.  If you are wanting to capture your child's first steps or special moments like that, I suggest a faster camera.  It would probably be a great first camera for older children.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera for less
Reviews.Author: Andres Duran
Reviews.Content: Person I gave it to seems to enjoy it.  But they could use more color options.

Reviews.Title: Works well but i expected a better quality >>
Reviews.Author: Reynaldo
Reviews.Content: The pictures look like 6.5MP =/, i expected 8mp but im fine with it, not a problem is for personal use anyway.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Fift
Reviews.Author: Duane J. Richards
Reviews.Content: Hello:Purchased this item as a donation gift for a very poor family.  Thye love it.

Reviews.Title: Better than Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Cross-eyed
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to give as a gift and I prefer it to my Nikon Coolpix.  Easy to use.  One drawback is that it lacks an adapter, so batteries are necessary.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: Samuel May
Reviews.Content: Ordered for a relative for Christmas. At first the item was on back order. Then the order was cancelled with no comment. No thanks to that type of service.

Reviews.Title: Tigerdirect Availability Info Inaccurate
Reviews.Author: S. Chhak
Reviews.Content: You need to call the merchant (TD) to verify the availability before ordering. The site info is not accurate. I ordered a package, camera and SD card on 1/02, and through out the order process, TD kept showing the expected delivery date as 1/05.  That was the main reason I placed the order, quick delivery.Then came something that was not very smart (polite wording); they shipped the SD card and back ordered the camera. What am I supposed to do with the SD card?Even with the call to check, I doubt that it would make any differences if the salesperson is also using the web site.Do not BELIEVE or TRUST info given on the TD site. No more TD for me.
